arm_group.description: Group 3 : Horizontal slit beam assisted marker group

brief_summary.textblock:
Before astigmatism reducing surgery, accurate corneal horizontal marking before surgery is
      important. Due to new corneal topographic method, iTrace™ surgical workstation, precise
      evaluation of corneal horizontal marking is available. In this study the investigators
      compared three known corneal horizontal making techniques and evaluate accuracy of each
      methods using iTrace™.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Three Corneal Horizontal Marking Techniques Using iTrace™

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients who were scheduled to have cataract surgery

          -  Age between 50 to 85 years

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  With an underlying corneal or conjunctival disorder

study_pop.textblock:
Who visited professor Tae Im Kim's clinic, department of ophthalmology, Severance
        hospital.

facility.name: Institute of Vision Research, Department of Ophthalmology, Yonsei University College of Medicine

primary_outcome.description: Nasal and temporal marked spots saved in iTrace surgical workstation program.
primary_outcome.measure: The vertical height deviation and rotational axis misalignment amount of each three marking techniques, evaluated by iTrace surgical workstation.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 10 minutes after corneal horizontal marking.

reference.citation: Hoffer KJ. Biometry of 7,500 cataractous eyes. Am J Ophthalmol. 1980 Sep;90(3):360-8.

Cha D, Kang SY, Kim SH, Song JS, Kim HM. New axis-marking method for a toric intraocular lens: mapping method. J Refract Surg. 2011 May;27(5):375-9. doi: 10.3928/1081597X-20101005-01. Epub 2010 Oct 15.
